node.title: Paying for public transport
node.description: The Detail - Fares on public transport are half price until the end of June, but to what extent are our bus and train trips already subsidised by the government and local councils?

node.title: An unruly passenger left an American Airlines flight— emergency slide first
node.description: Cynthia McKnight was arrested and all other passengers on the plane were rebooked.

node.title: Tell-tale hints before volcanic eruptions found using AI
node.description: Researchers have pinpointed precursors to volcanic eruptions, in data collected before explosions including the deadly 2019 Whakaari surge that killed 22 people.

node.title: Dwayne Haskins ran out of gas before he was killed, 911 call shows
node.description: The Steelers quarterback was killed on April 9 while trying to cross Interstate 595 in Broward County, Florida.

node.title: 21 charged in alleged $149 million COVID-19 fraud schemes
node.description: Physicians, marketers and medical businesses across nine U.S. federal districts are among those facing charges.

node.title: Americans often "forced" to pay medical bills they don't owe
node.description: Many people say they pay health care bills even if the debt isn't valid, consumer watchdog finds.

node.title: NZTA aiming to increase regulatory staffing
node.description: The Transport Agency aims to add more than half as many regulatory staff as it already has, to restore its policing muscle.

node.title: Housing supply and heritage: How is Auckland going to change?
node.description: The face of Auckland is set to change as new government legislation is introduced to increase housing supply. Audio

node.title: Florida Senate votes to strip Disney of special self-government status
node.description: The vote marks the latest escalation of DeSantis' battle with the entertainment giant over Florida's new "Don't Say Gay" law.

node.title: Black Ferns Sevens star backs Bunting as replacement for Moore
node.description: Black Ferns Sevens star Tyla Nathan-Wong has endorsed coach Allan Bunting, as an ideal replacement for Glenn Moore in the Black Ferns fifteens.

node.title: Aussie PM nixes claims appeal to Solomon Islands was bungled
node.description: Accusations the Australian government bungled a security relationship prior to the Solomon Islands signing a pact with China have been dismissed by the Australian PM.

node.title: South Carolina prisoner's execution by firing squad halted by court
node.description: The order by the state Supreme Court puts on hold at least temporarily the planned April 29 execution of Richard Bernard Moore.

node.title: Increase in office building sales likely - commercial property developer
node.description: A commercial property developer expects more office buildings will be sold in coming months, as firms struggle to lease space and meet rising construction costs.

node.title: Elon Musk looks to raise funds to buy Twitter: reports
node.description: Cryptic tweet suggests Tesla CEO may try to buy shares of the social media service directly from investors.

node.title: Five ways to make your home more Earth-friendly
node.description: These five changes can help your home curb climate change, on Earth Day and every day.

node.title: NZR address post-match red card comments with Super Rugby teams
node.description: New Zealand Rugby have told the Super Rugby franchises to watch what they're saying in their post-match interviews.

node.title: Feds find "severe, systemic" problems in Mississippi prison
node.description: The department released findings of its two-year investigation of the state's oldest prison, Mississippi State Penitentiary at Parchman​.

node.title: Beloved therapy dog named official dog of Boston Marathon
node.description: He's become a local celebrity at the Boston Marathon. This year, he received a big honor ahead of this year's marathon – and during it.

node.title: Armed suspects take $70K of money and jewelry in brazen L.A. robbery
node.description: Following a dip in follow-home robberies in March, there has been a considerable uptick in April, police reported last week.

node.title: Illinois man accidentally inhales drill bit during dental procedure
node.description: Doctors believe that the man inhaled just before he coughed, sending the 1-inch bit deep into his lung.

node.title: Father was working near son when he died at Auckland port
node.description: The father of the man who died at Ports of Auckland yesterday was working there when the tragedy unfolded. Audio

node.title: "Frankenstein opioids" becoming more prevalent in Ohio, attorney general warns
node.description: The drugs called nitazenes are not approved for medical use anywhere in the world.

node.title: Make Uranus mission your priority, Nasa told
node.description: US space agency Nasa should prioritise a mission to Uranus, an influential panel of scientists says.

node.title: Most U.S. travelers support mask regulations on planes, transit: Poll
node.description: Support among most Americans for mask mandates on planes comes even as worries about COVID-19 are at an all-time low.

node.title: "Rust" production company fined $136,000 for alleged safety failures
node.description: New Mexico safety officials pointed to "a complete failure of the employer to follow recognized national protocols that keep employees safe."

node.title: Liverpool crush Manchester United go top of EPL
node.description: Mohamed Salah scored twice as Liverpool comfortably beat old rivals Manchester United 4-0 at Anfield to move top of the Premier League, for 24 hours at least.

node.title: Netflix rocked by first loss of subscribers in 10 years
node.description: Netflix is blaming inflation, the war in Ukraine and fierce competition and is predicting deeper losses lie ahead.

node.title: Developers cutting asking prices as housing market slows
node.description: Property developers are cutting their asking prices by tens of thousands of dollars as they try to entice buyers amid a slowing market.

node.title: Rapper A$AP Rocky arrested in connection with 2021 shooting
node.description: According to police, the rapper allegedly shot an acquaintance after an argument.

node.title: Experimental Minnesota forest helps predict climate change scenarios
node.description: Researchers come to the forest to study how different degrees of global warming might impact the world's northern forests.
